Mountain Bluebird.notes: Idaho’s state bird. Often perches on fenceposts and hunts insects midair.

Yellow Warbler.notes: Their 'sweet-sweet-sweet, I’m so sweet!' song is common near rivers and streams.

Western Meadowlark.notes: Their melodic song echoes through southeastern Idaho farmland.

Song Sparrow.notes: Common along the Snake River. Recognizable for their variable but structured songs.

American Kestrel.notes: Often seen perched along roadsides or hovering over grass hunting mice and insects.
